intro: Steffensia coccoloboides, commonly known as the Florida beautyberry, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its showy, violet-blue berries that appear in the fall. The plant typically grows in wetlands and swampy areas, preferring moist, acidic soils. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy appearance, while its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The berries are an important food source for various bird species and are also used in traditional herbal medicine.
